lenders.occupational_info: PaydayFinancial.co.uk is not a payday loan lender but an online loan matching service. lenders.name: Damien
lenders.loan_because:
It took me far too long to take the leap and consistently offer a tiny portion of my income to help others… I loved the concept of Kiva the moment I saw it. To me Kiva is akin to 'Give someone a fish, they'll eat for a day. Teach someone to fish, they'll eat for a lifetime'. It's especially important to help those actively trying to help themselves, their families and their communities as they aim to make a sustainable improvement to the quality of life. 
 
I'm pleased to see there are no ulterior motives behind doing good here, other than being good. I praise Kiva for explaining all aspects of the process openly and that the money we give for loans & donations to Kiva, are clearly and separately defined. Unfortunately some charities (but thankfully not all), spend exorbitantly high percentages of their donations on administration &/or ulterior motives which are often not clearly stated and in reality don’t provide the best help for those in need.    

I’m an atheist and I aim to treat people the way I would like to be treated - I believe it's this simple idea that will hopefully make the world a better place for all people. Therefore, it's important to me to try and be a considerate human being, to make at least some outward effort (beyond cheap talk and likes on Facebook) to help people less fortunate. It also forces me to take a second and appreciate what I do have and what I daily take for granted just a little more, rather than seeing the negative in everything around me, as we so easily and often do.

lenders.name: kyambadde
lenders.loan_because: i want to invest in a 5 acre agricultural project to use the land that was left by my late grand father so that i can raise my self fees and also help other brethren get food at affordable prices.
lenders.occupational_info:
THE BRIDE OF CHRIST AROUND THE WORLD
P.O.BOX 459 Mityana Uganda. 
TEL; +256(0)776119430,+256(0)791558871
•                            Email; thebrideofchristaroundtheworld@yahoo.com
• 


 PROJECT PROPOSAL FOR ENHANCING FOOD SECURITY AMONG  MEMBERS HOUSEHOLDS.

i) PHYSICAL LOCATION; 
Mubende District, Kiganda Sub County, Kamusenene Parish, Bulyankuyege Lc I.

ii) CONTACT PERSON;
• Mr. Richard Kyambadde, P.o.Box 459 Mityana, Tel; + 256 (0)776119430                                                                    email; thebrideofchristaroundtheworld@yahoo.com
• 

iii) Total project cost;     6,785,020 Shs.
SOURCE OF FUNDING;  Sponsor.

Funding Gap;   6,785,020 Shs.
iv) PROJECT DURATION
Twelve ( 12 ) Months. 

(I) Back ground information;
Richard Kyambadde is a youth who has got access to a vast piece of family land and has got a plan of putting this land to use by engaging it to profitable Agriculture production.
The plan is to start with land clearance which will be followed with Maize production for the proceeding two seasons and eventually the area will be used for Pineapple and Beans growing at three and Two acreage respectively.

(II) Problem statement;
          Presently, there is a rampant problem of Land grabbing especially for land which is
found laying idle or underutilized so Richard has realized that to safeguard the family land against  such a possibility and the accompanying problems, and from the fact that the food prices are increasing and almost doubling and yet the Christians are almost going Hungry, it has been realized to be  wise to put this land to Farming as a Business in order to tap the readily available market for the food stuffs in the country and even in the neighboring countries as well as saving the lives of Members of the Bride of Christ around the world Church community by giving them maize at a relatively lower costs than what other shops charge .

(III) Project beneficiaries and benefits;
We hope that if the project goes on well it will provide employment to a number of youth in the community who will be providing us with labor, the surrounding farmers will benefit by copying the modern methods which we are going to use on this farm, while the traders will be assured of getting reasonable quantities of produce from the same farm as opposed to collecting the required amounts from all over the parish which has a cost implication, and above all the Church members will be inspired to grow own food through seeing from this farm and they will also get maize for maize floor at a relatively lower price than what other shops charge  .

(II) Project goal;
To Develop profitable Agro production unit to supply the Domestic market in Uganda and the neighboring countries and to inspire the Christristians around the World to be food secure in their homes. 

(III) Project Objective;
The project to begin with five acres of Maize grown on well cultivated land, fenced
 against the cattle presently roaming on the land, with an intention of gradually progressing into a commercial mixed farm growing highly profitable crops as required in the market region to increase in size up to 100 acres out of the available 290 acres.

(IV) Project activities;

We shall start with Bush clearance followed with stump up rooting making the field suitable for Tractor first land preparation
First ploughing and second ploughing will be done using hired tractor services.
The cleared land will be well fenced using Barbed wire and poles to protect it from stray animals and petty thieves.
Planting of maize will follow, observing all the recommended Agronomic practices like; timeliness of operations starting at the end of May 2011 with bush clearance and fine seed bed preparation, use of high yielding seed, hybrid Panar variety, right spacing of 
(75 cms x  60 cms.), application of a Basal fertilizer before planting which will be followed with top dressing at six weeks. Pest and disease control programs will be strictly observed until the time of harvesting and in storage to minimize post Harvest losses.
Post harvest handling will be carefully planned for and carried out to minimize possible losses and the best marketing techniques will be applied to get the best price that will be prevailing at the time.
           Two seasons will be used to recover some of the preliminary costs and eventually more paying crops like pineapples will be planted where the maize will be harvested on second planting

(v) Project Operations and Management;
Richard will be responsible for the first day to day preparatory arrangements with the guidance of a professional consultant, but later the operations will be handed to an experienced farm manager who will be recruited in the course of time.
